name: Fateh Garh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many of the comments about Fateh Garh have focused, justifiably, on the buildings, their location and the views over Udaipur. They are, indeed, spectacular. However, there is a somewhat crude expression in the North of England contrasting extravagant dress with an absence of underwear. The metaphor is very applicable here. A great deal of imagination and no small expense has gone into re-creating a palace on the top of a hill and filling it with artefacts garnered from elsewhere to create an imposing environment. But the result is uncomfortable in several aspects. Access is poor. From the dropping off point, guests have to tackle a steep slope to reach reception and, once inside - though there is a lift between the accommodation floors - everywhere else is accessed by stairs and flights of steps, some of them lengthy and steep. For some reason, the interior dining room is reserved for functions; thus requiring a guests to negotiate steps and a courtyard to reach another building (served with external kitchens) in order to eat.
reviews.title: Misplaced Priorities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since we have a special interest in disabled access, we enquired about this and were shown a vehicle route around the hotel which would enable a wheelchair user to reach a point at which they would be able to use a paved way and, with the use of a portable ramp, reach the ground floor. However, for anyone with moderate to severe mobility difficulties a great part of the hotel is difficult or impossible to access. When so much has gone into creating this complex it almost passes belief that modern building standards have been ignored.
reviews.title: Lovely setting and architecture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also a comfort issue around the hotel's layout. The open courtyards, galleries and terraces must be a blessing in warmer months when they contribute to relief from the temperatures at lower altitudes, but in late January they were distinctly chilly.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, gracious staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, service, in our experience, fell far short of what it should have been. It was slow. Waiters often brought things they had been asked not to bring, but failed to deliver what had been ordered. When a drink was wrongly served, instead of it being replaced, there was resistance and an insistence that we ought to try it. When a dish was left unfinished because it was over-salted and offers of a substitute had been politely but firmly refused, the self-same dish was produced 15 minutes later as we were about to leave the restaurant.
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.text: We had intimation from our driver and guide that there may have been recent changes of personnel. If so, their training needs had clearly been neglected and there was insufficient management to compensate for their lack of experience.
reviews.title: Amazing !

reviews.text: We spent four days at Fateh Garh during a wedding. Great days. The location is simply fantastic and quiet outside town with a wonderful view from Udaipur and the hills.
reviews.title: Four amazing days during a wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To go to the city you will need a car, which was no problem as the hotel organized taxi drivers for us.
reviews.title: Splendor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pools and terraces are perfect to relax and enjoy the sun. We had excellent weather with warm nights and having dinner on the terrace under the stars was an extra bonus I will not forget.
reviews.title: Serene and idyllic stay at Fateh Garh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel building is wonderful. There are very airy, large common areas for the guests to relax. The rooms are large, clean and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was very likable and helpful.
reviews.title: superbe views of udaipur - very clean, calm and comfy

reviews.text: Lots of stairs so it might not be ideal for young children and elderly.
reviews.title: A View for the kings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for 2 nights at this hotel as part of a wedding party. the hotel is very well maintained and was spotless. we were in the rooms facing one of the pools and the views were stunning. you could see all of udaipur from our room. the rooms are well furnished and had all the facilites such as tea making, minibar, slippers and bath robes. the only downside is that the wing in which we were located had no lift. access to the pool, rooms and the restaurant is via a number of very steep steps. for a hotel of this rating and cost, i found this very dissapointing. if any body wants to book this hotel, i would advise them to check where exactly will they be staying as i understand another wing did have a lift.the hotel is also on a hill so people with mobility issues may find this challenging.
reviews.title: excellent views of udaipur

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at this wonderful hotel. The view over the city and lake are incredible, the rooms big and clean, the decoration very traditional and what you may expect when visiting Rajasthan, although the hotel is only four years old. The food in the restaurant was among the best we had - both, indian and continental. A good choice!
reviews.title: What a view...!!

reviews.text: After reading a lot of good reviews we decided to stay @ Fateh Garh for a night . I must say the first impression of the resort is very nice . The resort is for persons who want to just relax and enjoy the views of the Udaipur city and its lakes. The real let down is the service at their restaurant overlooking the lake . It is a pity that having such a good property their service is a let down .
reviews.title: Good property but service is a let down...

reviews.text: My family of 3 stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during Dec'12. The view from the room was gr8..the room itself was very spacious..However, the food in the hotel was terribly expensive considering the fact that this is not an Oberoi or Taj property. The hotel is situated 7-8kms away from the main city. There are no eateries around. So the guests naturally are very dependent on the hotel restuarant for their meals - the hotel takes advantage of this very fact. So one should carefully weigh their options before deciding to stay in this hotel. The service of the hotel staff was satisfactory - they were very prompt in dealing with whatever small issues we had with the room etc.
reviews.title: Gr8 views, very expensive food...stay if you must!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all I would like to take this oppurtinity to thank all the staff at the Fatehgarh Resort for making our holiday such a memorable one.
reviews.title: The hotel with the best views in town

reviews.text: On my trip I had the opportunity to stay in some of the top quality hotels in Rahjastan and Fateh Garh was no doubt one of the best! The rooms were spacious and comfortable, the location lofty and picturesque, the facilities (e.g. pools, table tennis, restaurant) comprehensive and the service unmatched! The staff were extremely amiable, helpful and attentive. All our requests were performed to the best of the staffs abilities. In particular the manager of the front office (Nehpal Singh Chouhan) was extremely helpful.This hotel felt more like a resort, everything you want you have right there. It is the perfect sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city!
reviews.title: An idyllic experience
Hilltop Paradise
reviews.text: A delightful hotel overlooking one of the lakes in the Udaipur region. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed and the view is truly breath-taking. One of the nicest hotels I've stayed at anywhere in the world. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fateh Garh is located outside the city on a hill with the lake and city in the valley below. Breathtaking views in the morning and evening, wonderful food and rooms. It's easy to spend the day in Udaipur. Arrangements can be made with Nehpal Singh who took care of all logistics graciously including the driver and car to the next city on our itinerary.
reviews.title: A special place to splurge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying here I felt like royalty. The hotel is quiet and serene, a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The service was excellent, whatever we wanted was provided almost instantly. The food was fresh and delicious. There were beautiful sunrises and sunsets every day. Udaipur appears magically through the morning mist and the lights of the city twinkle in the moonlight. This is one of the most romantic places I have ever been. We put this place on our top ten list of best hotels in the world.
reviews.title: Stay here and feel like royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the end of our 2 week holiday in Northern India and it was a great place to relax and unwind. The hotel is lovely but the location and views are stunning! We had a corner room on the first foor with views on 2 sides allowing us to watch the sun set. The food was lovely and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.
reviews.title: Paradise!

description: Fateh Garh, a Heritage Renaissance Resort - Sanctuary, perched on the edge of Udaipur city in the Aravalli ranges, with 360° commanding views, welcomes guests with style & traditional fanfare. Fateh Garh, a 50 room property offers travelers a spacious, peaceful and quiet refuge from the noisy and crowded urban India. Conde Nast Hot List 2009:- "Until now the best places to stay in Udaipur have been the princely piles on Lake Pichola's shores or its fairy-tale island palace. Fateh Garh offers something different: "Heritage Renaissance" style. Perched on a hilltop 20 minutes outside the city, this newly constructed 51-room hotel incorporates local stone and antique architectural elements culled from abandoned historic buildings. A confection of bulbous domes, sugar-white pillars, crenellations, and intricate jali screens, it escapes the kitschy through its graceful proportions and airy reception areas, courtyard, and verandas—all of which are graced with antiques and delicate frescoes inspired by the style of Rajput miniatures. Lie by the infinity pool, listening to the sound of splashing fountains mingling with live classical shehnai music. The hotel kitchen does best with local Mewari dishes, which are a welcome change from standard Indian hotel fare".
